templates.description: Comprehensive template for implementing new product features

phases.name: Requirements & Planning
phases.description: Define feature requirements and create implementation plan
tasks: Create user stories and acceptance criteria

phases.name: Frontend Integration
phases.description: Create user interface and integrate with backend

phases.name: Testing & Quality Assurance
tasks: Write unit tests for backend logic

phases.name: Documentation & Deployment
phases.description: Document feature and prepare for release

projectIntent.label: What are you building?
projectIntent.description: Describe the main purpose and functionality of this feature
examples: User authentication system with JWT tokens
E-commerce shopping cart with payment processing
Real-time chat system for customer support
Data analytics dashboard for sales metrics
File upload system with cloud storage

businessValue.label: Why is this important?
businessValue.description: Explain the business value and user benefit
examples: Enable secure user registration and login
Allow customers to purchase products online
Improve customer service response times
Provide insights for data-driven decisions
Allow users to share documents easily

successCriteria.label: How will you know it's successful?
examples: Users can register and login successfully
Payment processing works with 99.9% reliability
Average response time under 2 seconds
Dashboard loads data in under 5 seconds
Files upload successfully 95% of the time

qualityRequirements.label: What quality standards must it meet?

templates.description: Systematic approach to resolving multiple bugs

phases.name: Bug Triage & Analysis
phases.description: Categorize and prioritize bugs for resolution
tasks: Review and categorize all reported bugs
Prioritize bugs by severity and impact
Estimate effort for each bug fix

phases.name: Standard Bug Resolution
phases.description: Address medium and low priority bugs

phases.name: Testing & Validation
tasks: Run regression tests on all fixes

projectIntent.label: What bugs are you fixing?
projectIntent.description: Describe the scope and type of bugs being addressed
examples: Fix critical security vulnerabilities in user authentication
Resolve performance issues causing slow page loads
Address data synchronization bugs in real-time features
Fix UI inconsistencies across different browsers
Resolve integration issues with third-party services

businessValue.label: Why fix these bugs now?
examples: Prevent security breaches and data loss
Improve user experience and reduce churn
Ensure system stability and reliability
Meet compliance and regulatory requirements
Reduce customer support burden

successCriteria.label: How will you measure success?
examples: All critical bugs resolved and verified
No new regressions introduced
Customer complaint rate reduced by 50%
System uptime improved to 99.5%
Page load times under 3 seconds

phases.name: Code Analysis & Planning
phases.description: Analyze current code and plan improvements

projectIntent.label: What are you refactoring?
projectIntent.description: Describe the code areas and improvements planned
examples: Refactor legacy authentication module to use modern patterns
Clean up database access layer and eliminate duplication
Restructure frontend components for better reusability
Optimize API response handling and error management
Modernize build system and dependency management

businessValue.label: Why refactor now?
businessValue.description: Explain the need and expected benefits
examples: Reduce development time for new features
Improve code maintainability and reduce bugs
Enable better team collaboration and onboarding
Prepare codebase for scaling and new requirements
Reduce technical debt and development friction

successCriteria.label: How will you measure improvement?
examples: Code duplication reduced by 50%
Cyclomatic complexity under target thresholds
Test coverage increased to 85%
Build time reduced by 30%
Developer onboarding time reduced

phases.name: Testing Strategy & Setup
phases.description: Plan testing approach and set up infrastructure
tasks: Define testing strategy and coverage goals
Set up testing frameworks and tools
Plan test data and environment setup

phases.name: Unit Testing Implementation
tasks: Write unit tests for core business logic
Test edge cases and error conditions

projectIntent.label: What testing are you implementing?
projectIntent.description: Describe the testing scope and strategy
examples: Implement comprehensive unit testing for backend APIs
Create automated integration tests for payment processing
Build end-to-end tests for user registration flow
Add performance testing for data processing pipeline
Create security testing for authentication system

businessValue.label: Why invest in testing?
businessValue.description: Explain the value and risk mitigation
examples: Prevent bugs from reaching production
Enable confident deployment and releases
Reduce manual testing time and costs
Improve code quality and maintainability
Enable faster development with safety net

successCriteria.label: What testing goals will you achieve?
examples: Achieve 85% unit test code coverage
All critical user flows have automated tests
API endpoints have 100% integration test coverage
Automated test suite runs in under 10 minutes
Zero critical bugs escape to production
